attributes.action: We request the Prime Minister intervene to ensure a representative residence' association be formed on the Exmouth Estate.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In May 2006, the Exmouth Estate was transferred to Swan Housing
Association from the London Borough of Tower Hamlets. Since this date a
small group of residents called the Exmouth Estate Residents Board
(EERB), claimed to speak for all residents of the Estate, despite
lacking signed mandates from residents authorising them to do so.

In defiance of TSA regulations, the EERB is the only Exmouth residents'
association Swan HA will recognise. Swan Housing refuses to consult,
involve and engage, other legitimate, democratically elected &
demographically representative, residents' associations on the Estate.

Together, Swan HA and the EERB have made major decisions, with little or
no consultation with the majority of residents; decisions which not
only impact on the residents' quality of life, but also have 
financial consequences for tenants and leaseholders alike.

We the undersigned did not choose to be represented by the EERB.  Our
voices are ignored by Swan HA. We reject EERB's claim to
authority and protest their lack of democratic process and principles.
We have the democratic right to be consulted on decisions that impact on
our quality of life and this is not happening.

rejection.details: We suggest you contact the local council/your local councillor, as this would be a matter for local authorities in the first instance.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
